text: FastAPI is a modern, fast web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+ based on standard Python type hints.
Kong API Gateway provides routing, authentication, rate limiting, and load balancing for microservices architectures.
Microservices communicate over lightweight protocols such as HTTP, gRPC, and message queues for asynchronous processing.
Idempotent request handling ensures duplicate requests with the same identifier yield the same result without side effects.
Policy services can deny or allow access based on request content, user roles, and business rules.
Docker containers provide isolated environments for running microservices with consistent dependencies across platforms.
API gateways act as a single entry point for client requests, handling cross-cutting concerns like security and monitoring.
Rate limiting prevents abuse by restricting the number of requests a client can make within a time window.
Authentication mechanisms like API keys, JWT tokens, and OAuth2 verify the identity of clients making requests.
Distributed tracing with trace IDs and request IDs helps debug issues across multiple microservices.
RESTful APIs use HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) to perform CRUD operations on resources.
Service orchestration coordinates multiple microservices to fulfill complex business workflows and transactions.
Load balancing distributes incoming requests across multiple service instances to ensure high availability.
Circuit breakers prevent cascading failures by stopping requests to failing services temporarily.
Message queues like RabbitMQ and Kafka enable asynchronous communication between decoupled services.
Database per service pattern ensures each microservice has its own database for data independence.
API versioning strategies include URL path versioning, header versioning, and content negotiation.
Health check endpoints allow monitoring systems to verify if a service is running correctly.
Logging and monitoring are essential for observability in distributed microservices architectures.
JSON and XML are common data formats for request and response payloads in web APIs.
